definition: a powder of alumina, silica, lime, iron oxide, and magnesium oxide burned together in a kiln and finely pulverized and used as an ingredient of mortar and concrete, any mixture used for a similar purpose
a binding element or agency: such as
a substance to make objects adhere to each other

examples: justice is the cement that holds a political community together

definition: a plastic composition made especially of zinc or silica for filling dental cavities
the fine-grained groundmass or glass of a porphyry
to unite or make firm by or as if by cement
examples: Pebbles were cemented together by clay.
has cemented his role as a leader on the team
